bug.author: lixiepeng
bug.summary: torch must be imported before import allennlp
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Checklist</denchmark-h>
I have verified that the issue exists against the master branch of AllenNLP. I have read the relevant section in the contribution guide on reporting bugs. I have checked the issues list for similar or identical bug reports. I have checked the pull requests list for existing proposed fixes. I have checked the CHANGELOG and the commit log to find out if the bug was already fixed in the master branch. I have included in the "Description" section below a traceback from any exceptions related to this bug. I have included in the "Related issues or possible duplicates" section beloew all related issues and possible duplicate issues (If there are none, check this box anyway). I have included in the "Environment" section below the name of the operating system and Python version that I was using when I discovered this bug. I have included in the "Environment" section below the output of pip freeze. I have included in the "Steps to reproduce" section below a minimally reproducible example.
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
Python traceback:
from allennlp.common.util import import_module_and_submodules
D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\allennlp\__init__.py in <module> 16 # On some systems this prevents the dreaded 17 # ImportError: dlopen: cannot load any more object with static TLS ---> 18 import spacy, torch, numpy # noqa 19 20 except ModuleNotFoundError:
D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\__init__.py in <module> 114 err = ctypes.WinError(last_error) 115 err.strerror += ' Error loading "{}" or one of its dependencies.'.format(dll) --> 116 raise err 117 elif res is not None: 118 is_loaded = True
OSError: [WinError 127] Êâæ‰∏çÂà∞ÊåáÂÆöÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇ Error loading "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\lib\caffe2_detectron_ops_gpu.dll" or one of its dependencies.
Ipython Console: In [1]: import torch
In [2]: import allennlp
In [3]:
CMD: C:\Users\xxx>allennlp Traceback (most recent call last): File "d:\anaconda3\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", mod_spec) File "d:\anaconda3\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code exec(code, run_globals) File "D:\Anaconda3\Scripts\allennlp.exe\__main__.py", line 5, in <module> File "d:\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\allennlp\__init__.py", line 18, in <module> import spacy, torch, numpy # noqa File "d:\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\__init__.py", line 116, in <module> raise err OSError: [WinError 127] Êâæ‰∏çÂà∞ÊåáÂÆöÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇ Error loading "d:\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\lib\caffe2_detectron_ops_gpu.dll" or one of its dependencies.
<denchmark-h:h2>Related issues or possible duplicates</denchmark-h>
None
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS: Win10 64 Python version: python 3.7.3
Output of pip freeze:
torch==1.6.0 allennlp==1.1.0rc3 allennlp-models==1.1.0rc3
<denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Example source:
from allennlp.common.util import import_module_and_submodules or CMD: allennlp

comments.comment: Sorry, we don't officially support Windows. Inofficially though I would hope this works. This is probably caused by some incompatibilities in your environment. How do you install torch, and the rest of the dependencies? Do you use virtualenv or conda?
This issue is being closed due to lack of activity. If you think it still needs to be addressed, please comment on this thread üëá
